Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 17th overall pick, by Texas in 1967...
Had first career hit on 4/14/1972, off Mike Davison (MIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/15/1972, off Al Stanek (NYY)...
Won World Series with Texas in 1972...
Drove in 6 runs against Minnesota on 8/18/1975...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1976...
Traded from Texas to St. Louis on 6/16/1978 (Going to STL: 2B R. Smith, 3B T. Perez, SS T. Harrah, P R. Moffitt. Going to TEX: 2B J. Castino, 1B L. Durham, CF D. Ford, P P. Falcone)...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1981, hitting .500 with 1 HR, 6 RBI...
Injured on 8/8/1983 with a Strained Groin Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 6/20/1984 with a Pulled Back Muscle, out for one week...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Cincinnati on 9/7/1984...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/12/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $12,340,000 per year...
Had 6 hits with 3 RBI against New York (A) on 4/20/1986...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/21/1986, hitting .516 with 0 HR, 10 RBI...
Was selected to the 1986 Allstar game...
